org.chronos.chronodb.internal.api.index

Interface ChronoIndexModifications

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    ChronoIndexModificationsImpl

    public interface ChronoIndexModifications
    Instances of this class represent a collection of modifications that should be applied on the secondary index.

    Essentially, this class is a wrapper around a collection of modification objects. The benefit of this class is the easier API compared to plain collections, as well as additional utility methods (e.g. groupByBranch()).

    You can create a new instance of this class via the static factory method create().

      • addDocumentValidityTermination

        default void addDocumentValidityTermination(ChronoIndexDocument document,
                                            long timestamp)
        Adds the validity termination of the given document at the given timestamp.
        Parameters:
        document - The document to terminate the validity range for. Must not be null.
        timestamp - The timestamp at which the validity should be terminated. Must not be negative.

      • addDocumentValidityTermination

        default void addDocumentValidityTermination(java.util.Set<ChronoIndexDocument> documents,
                                            long timestamp)
        Adds one validity termination for each of the given documents, at the given timestamp.
        Parameters:
        documents - The documents to terminate the validity for. Must not be null.
        timestamp - The timestamp at which to terminate the validity of the given documents. Must not be negative.

      • addDocumentAddition

        default void addDocumentAddition(ChronoIdentifier identifier,
                                 java.lang.String indexName,
                                 java.lang.Object indexValue)
        Adds a new document addition with the given parameters.
        Parameters:
        identifier - The ChronoIdentifier to which the new document should refer. Must not be null.
        indexName - The name of the index to which the new document belongs. Must not be null.
        indexValue - The indexed value to store in the new document. Must not be null.

      • addDocumentAddition

        default void addDocumentAddition(ChronoIndexDocument indexDocument)
        Adds a new document addition for the given index document.
        Parameters:
        indexDocument - The document to create the document addition for. Must not be null.

        default void addDocumentDeletion(ChronoIndexDocument document)

      • groupByBranch

        default java.util.Map<java.lang.String,ChronoIndexModifications> groupByBranch()
        Splits the modifications currently stored in this object into new modifications, grouped by branch.

        This will not change the current state of this object. Any further modifications to this object will not be reflected in the resulting groups.

        If a branch has no modifications in this object, there will be no entry for that branch in the resulting map.

        Returns:
        The mapping from branch name to modifications. Never null, may be empty.
